snippet: Backup catcher Mike Nickeas’s double led to Jordany Valdespin’s first major league hit, a three-run homer in the ninth that sent the Mets to their third straight win.
abstract: New York Mets defeat Philadelphia Phillies, 5-2; Mets backup shortstop Jordany Valdespin gets his first major league hit, a three-run homer in the ninth to send the Mets to their third straight win. Photo (M)
lead_paragraph: PHILADELPHIA -- Jordany Valdespin stood by his locker in the visitors' clubhouse at Citizens Bank Park, cleaning shaving cream out of his ear and soaking in the beer that his teammates sprayed on him in celebration. On Saturday, Valdespin was with the Mets. On Sunday, he was with Class AAA Buffalo. On Monday, he was back with the Mets and served as the unlikely hero in the Mets' 5-2 victory over the Philadelphia Phillies.

headline.main: A Met's First Career Hit Is a Big One in the Ninth
